str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Plural
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Plural
str2: From pleion; to do, make or be more, i.e. Increase; by extension, to superabound.

word: they will keep you from being
parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and histemi; to place down, i.e. to designate, constitute, convoy.
Idle, lazy, thoughtless, unprofitable, injurious. (by implication) lazy, useless.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
